source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_004_chunk1

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_004_chunk3

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_004_chunk3
evidence_span: Another series of results reported by Ross-Ross [14] involved a still different type of creep measurement, diametral changes of cold-worked Zircaloy reactor pressure tubes. These results covered a moderate range in flux levels on the order of $1 0 ^ { 1 7 } \mathrm { n } / \mathrm { m } ^ { 2 } \mathrm { s }$ $\mathbf { \dot { \theta } } _ { E } > 1 \mathbf { \Theta } \mathbf { M } \mathbf { e } \mathbf { V } ,$ , a small temperature range in the neighborhood of $2 7 5 \ \mathbf { K }$ and a circumferential stress ranging from 62 to 131 MPa.
